name: src/adt/DAryHeap.js
src/adt/DAryHeapWithoutReferences.js
src/adt/index.js
src/core/index.js
src/core/makeheap.js
makeheap
description: Builds a heap in O(n) operations.

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/merge.js
merge
description:
Merges heaps at intervals [i, j[ and [j, k[ in array *a*
into a new heap at interval [i, k[.

Hypothesis :

  - i <= j <= k
  - j - 1 is the last leaf ot the first heap

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the two heaps are stored

params.name: i
params.description: is the root of the first heap

params.name: j
params.description: is the root of the second heap

params.name: k
params.description: 1 is the index of the last leaf in the second heap

name: src/core/nextchild.js
nextchild
description:
Computes which child is the smallest according
to a comparison function.

Hypothesis : i < j i.e. there should be at least one child

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/pop.js
pop
description:
Pops the root from a d-ary heap.

Hypothesis : i < j

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/pull.js
pull
description: Sifts a node up to the root as if its priority was the highest.

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/push.js
push
description:
Inserts the jth element of an array in an existing
dary heap in interval [i, j[.

Hypothesis : i <= j

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/remove.js
remove
description:
Removes a target element from a d-ary heap.

Hypothesis : i < j

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/siftdown.js

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/siftup.js

params.name: a
params.description: the array where the heap is stored

name: src/core/sorted.js
src/index.js
content:
import {
	DAryHeap ,
	DAryHeapWithoutReferences ,
} from './adt' ;

import {
	makeheap ,
	merge ,
	nextchild ,
	pop ,
	pull ,
	push ,
	remove ,
	siftdown ,
	siftup ,
	sorted ,
} from './core' ;

export default {
	DAryHeap ,
	DAryHeapWithoutReferences ,
	makeheap ,
	merge ,
	nextchild ,
	pop ,
	pull ,
	push ,
	remove ,
	siftdown ,
	siftup ,
	sorted ,
} ;

export {
	DAryHeap ,
	DAryHeapWithoutReferences ,
	makeheap ,
	merge ,
	nextchild ,
	pop ,
	pull ,
	push ,
	remove ,
	siftdown ,
	siftup ,
	sorted ,
} ;

[@aureooms/js-d-ary-heap](https://aureooms.github.io/js-d-ary-heap) == `d`-ary heap data structure library for JavaScript. See [docs](https://aureooms.github.io/js-d-ary-heap). Parent is [@aureooms/js-heap](https://github.com/aureooms/js-heap). ```js makeheap( 2 , increasing , swap , array , 0 , array.length ) ; // ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ // arity ordering swap input [left , right[ // method // let heap = new DAryHeap( 2 , compare.increasing ) ; // ^ ^ // arity ordering // ``` content: # Overview

name: ./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[jspm](http://jspm.io)
or [npm](https://github.com/npm/npm).

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@aureooms/js-d-ary-heap
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @aureooms/js-d-ary-heap --save
```
